track.name: Algorithms
track.descriptions: The true test of problem solving: when one realizes that time and memory aren't infinite.

primary_contest.description:
Join our biggest contest, Week of Code 28! This is a 7 day contest beginning Monday, January 9th at 12:00am PDT. 

Each day, we’ll unlock a new challenge for you to solve. The top 10 hackers win exclusive HackerRank T-shirts. Sign up now and we’ll send you a quick reminder each day to keep you on track. See you on the leaderboard!
primary_contest.name: Week of Code 28

model.haskell_template:
import Control.Applicative
import Control.Monad
import System.IO


main :: IO ()
main = do
    n_temp <- getLine
    let n_t = words n_temp
    let n = read $ n_t!!0 :: Int
    let k = read $ n_t!!1 :: Int
    balls <- getLine
    -- your code goes here

getMultipleLines :: Int -> IO [String]

getMultipleLines n
    | n <= 0 = return []
    | otherwise = do          
        x <- getLine         
        xs <- getMultipleLines (n-1)    
        let ret = (x:xs)    
        return ret
model.preview: Find the expected number of white balls picked.
model.clojure_template:
(use '[clojure.string :only (split triml)])

(
        let [
          n_temp (read-line) 
          n_t (split n_temp #"\s+") 
          n (Integer/parseInt (n_t 0)) 
          k (Integer/parseInt (n_t 1)) 
        ]

      (
        let [
          balls (read-line)  
        ]
      )

    ; your code goes here
)
model.erlang_template:
-module(solution).
-export([main/0]).

main() ->

    { ok, [N,K]} = io:fread("", "~d~d"),
    { ok, [Balls]} = io:fread("", "~s"),
    % your code goes here
    true.

read_array(0,D) -> [];
read_array(N,D) -> 
	{ok, [X]} = io:fread("", D),
	[X | read_array(N-1,D)].

read_2darray(0,M,D) -> [];
read_2darray(N,M,D) ->
	Q=read_array(M,D),
	[Q | read_2darray(N-1,M,D)].
